author: Thomas Guppy
comment: Great app & support.

author: Kay Dee McCoy
comment: Worked now since bluetooth is rarely used  and connects when it wants to (bluetooth is so ifie) and wifi have become the main connection between phone and watch since Android 2.0, this needs to be upgrade to also use wifi to connect the 2 together.

author: Mihai-Daniel Muresan
comment: No longer working after switching to huawei P10 on my Huawei watch

author: Barry Morgan
comment: Thank you

author: Alex Sandberg
comment: I use Poweramp all the time and this app is perhaps the single most useful thing I could have on a smartwatch.  There is ONE thing I wish I were be able to do though, and I really hope you add it soon:   I want to able to select from a list of albums by a single artist. Right now, the album list simply shows ALL the albums by ALL the artists in my library. And selecting an artist from the artist list takes me to a list of ALL that artist's tracks. I want to be able to select an artist and be taken to a list of that artist's albums. This would make it much faster to navigate to a specific track, since I don't want to scroll through every single album in my library, and I don't really want to search by talking into the microphone either. Please consider allowing the user to browse through albums by a single artist; this would make it a five-star app for me. Thank you.  PS: If somehow there actually is a way to do what I described without talking into the microphone, please let me know, but as it is I don't think there is a way to do it yet.

author: Christopher Parsons
comment: Not working on Huawei at all since recent Android Wear updates. Used to work most of the time before, although the stock player controls were always fighting Power Amp Remote.  I prefer this app to the stock controls. Hopefully it will get fixed.

author: James Yau
comment: Works perfectly with Poweramp, glad to have total control over my music on my phone. Would be great for alternative icons though, I'm using the Kitkat theme on Poweramp and would be nice for it to match that. Would also be nice to see the album art on the track/album list.

author: Horiuchi Bonsai
comment: App works great but your video and pictures are way outdated in the play store.  Ideas. Is there anyway to mirror the poweramp playlist. I have gigs of music and cannot scroll through all of them. Is this possible on android wear?

author: Bri Robertson
comment: Works well but how do you get the clear/white control buttons on the watch screen ?, I have solid grey buttons which obscure the album art......

author: Martin Arkenstone
comment: Best remote app. Search is somewhat confusing.

author: wes mcfadden
comment: Does not work with Samsung S2

author: Mathew Smart
comment: No longer working on Pixel XL. Not showing on moto 360
Works great.

author: Efthimios Floros
comment: Great wrist remote for Poweramp player , have one issue where it won't sync and just sits on the last song played on the watch while Poweramp is still working ....Minor glitch. Hope this update resolved this issue.

author: Mark Armstrong
comment: Read the app description, make sure you stop the app sleeping or it wont work, ooops!!

reply.author: NeFa Studio
reply.content: Please check app is configured to work in sleep mode (many recent android phone sets app default not to work in sleep mode.)

author: Kapil Kumar
comment: This is quite possibly my favorite Wear app. It fills the glaring gap in media control that exists on Wear right now. I haven't faced any bugs so far on 6.0 and Wear 1.3(ZenWatch 2). I'm generally using a library with 350+ songs.
title: One of the most important Wear apps

author: iam cavie
comment: Its very good, love it! But... its always wrestling with the (much inferior) default player that i cannot disable (SW3) - makes trying to use it quite a saga sadly, where both programs wrestle for control.
title: Love it! - but...

author: Κλήμης Πεπές
comment: It shows wrong album art in most of my songs despite that in phone are shown correctly. If this is fixed will get 5 stars. I got moto360 1st gen
title: Wrong album art displayed

author: Steve May
comment: It works really well. All it needs it the ability to select the album then song after clicking artist and it would be nice to change the color scheme and skins. Also, it would be great if we could assign an EQ to something (such as playlist or headphones) and to edit the tone knobs as well. Overall, fantastic app.
title: Fantastic but still needs some tweaks.

author: Danny Kirk
comment: At first I was ready to give this one star, but stupid me, didn't know all the features were available with a center swipe up of down on the watch. If you have an android watch and are a major Poweramp user like I am, this app is a must! Headsets can only move to the next song and control volume. Now I  can switch to any music folder that I have created on Poweramp from my Huawei watch without having to pull out my phone! Great App for Android wear watches!!

author: Soon Kiang Teo
comment: Very useful. However, when playing some songs, their wrong album art is displayed on watch despite correct art displayed on phone.
title: Useful app with some bugs

author: Ian Troy Alvaran
comment: ...it doesn't display the time in-app. C'mon devs, if Google Maps can do it, you can add this as well. There's also the wrong Album art displayed, and I had to have it disabled. Hoping this can be updated
title: It works, except for one thing...

author: Ed's Youtube
comment: Not working with android wear 6.0.1 lg g watch gen 1
title: Not working used to be good

author: James Carter
comment: Great app but how do you turn it off?as it pops up when you are not using it Moto 360 2nd gen.
title: Like it

author: Jeremy Dennis
comment: worthless with more than 100 songs with the delay and lag

author: Metalmurphy
comment: why is the album art on the watch different from the one on the phone? How can I make them be the same?
title: Seems to work pretty well but

author: Joshua Low
comment: Really good app. Please fix music selection from playlist. I'm using a LG urbane 2. Thanks!
title: Fantastic!

author: Thiago Nitz
comment: The app works ok but not working with screen locked and not showing some album arts
title: The app works ok but...

author: Omar Sueque
comment: Works beautifully in my LG V10 > LG Urbane = no bugs at all.

author: Daniel Stonhill
comment: Love this App, a must for Android Wear

author: Tony Minides
comment: Too slow

reply.author: NeFa Studio
reply.content: What do you mean by "slow"? Control response? Track listup? It should respond / show list quickly.

author: Kishore Kumar
comment: More than what I expected....
title: Cool

author: Bryan Bennett
comment: Honestly awesome.

author: David O'Riordan
comment: This worked perfectly on a Note 3 running Android Lollipop 5.0. I have since upgraded to 5.1.1 and it appears that the controls now only work intermittently. Usually while (or shortly after) the phone's screen is on and unlocked which somewhat defeats the purpose of this application. Album art and information is displaying and the native Android Wear music controls seem to function without issue so I don't think it's a connectivity problem?  Is this perhaps a power saving issue when the phone screen is off? This was a five star app before this issue and if it could be resolved it would be again.

author: Christine M.
comment: This works pretty amazingly on my moto360!!! Problem is I can't see all my tracks at once. There's always a bunch cut off. Either this is a bug in the software or I have something set wrong. If this is fixed my rating will be 5 stars, because its frustrating to not be able to see all my songs.
title: Works great but tracks missing

author: Samuel Bencomo
comment: App continually disappears from my watch. Takes a lot of time to sync tracks, and controls stop working at random times. Also, the card controls could look better.
title: Very glitchy

author: Samuel Tee
comment: This app does a very good job of having a remote on android wear. Only complaints is that changing tracks from the app does not work (selecting tracks from the track list) and that the notification card looks incomplete. I would like a better look of the album art for the notification card. Other than that, the app is excellent. New UI looks great
title: Its been crashing a lot lately

author: Jeff D
comment: It works, does tracks, volume, and you can attempt to hunt down specific songs if you want. The app how ever has seen no real additional development. I think some things could be done better, like being able to swipe for track change instead of pressing small buttons. There is no user configurability.
title: Works well, but could be better

author: Lex Leonard
comment: "search all" doesn't seem to work and the interface isn't very intuitive, but other than that it's pretty much what I was looking for. Would be nice if it had real Google now voice search integration.
title: Close enough

author: jason stephens
comment: Love this app but recently ours been crashing every time i go pass the playlist pane or when i mess around with the playlist pane to long. Also doesn't show the names of my customized playlist.
title: Keeps crashing
